author: _shemnon
content: Your recollection is correct.  I too am curious why this didn't trigger the OE bug.  Was it OE's test config?  Was it a different corner case (interior call rather than a direct call)?

author: lightclient
content: <@!403707149043105803> it looks like this is Hive's testing config: https://github.com/ethereum/hive/blob/3aaff8a97f87d4c7adbab36f520803b6436f6b50/clients/openethereum/chain.json#L154-L159 vs. the mainnet config https://github.com/openethereum/openethereum/blob/582bca385fedb1af682e989e5bcc6b3b2cf53028/crates/ethcore/res/chainspec/foundation.json

author: _shemnon
content: So it's an OE chainspec config thing.  This is why I prefer composable configs, so one change (activate BLS12 never) propagates automatically instead of having to chase down where the configs are that need to be updated.  An open world model (where configs are in repos not controlled by you, unlike a corporate monorepo) makes it exponentially worse.

author: holiman
content:
To expand yet a bit: statetests (which is the basis of fuzzing) says: "execute on Berlin". Same with blockchain tests. They specificy one out of an enum of possible chains.

Geth chain configs are equally simple, we only allow to define which block a certain fork goes into effect. 

Oe (and Nethermind? And Besu?) configs are more complex, and each fork is defined by carefully combining features. This was in the case of parity a deliberate choice to support various forks/blockchains, not just eth mainnet and testnets. 

This high complexity led to a corner-case where a precompile was defined but inactive, combined with a flaw in obtaining the "list of precompiles" for 2929 which didn't check if it was active. In any "berlin" statetest, the precompile was undefined.

author: holiman
content: Actually, it's https://github.com/ethereum/hive/blob/master/clients/openethereum/mapper.jq

author: .fjl
content: Lightclient is the second person to get tripped by this. The chain.json file in hive's OE exists for the purpose of debugging the docker container (it won't boot without this file). The actual chain.json used for testing is generated using mapper.jq

author: lightclient
content: ah interesting - thanks for the clarification ðŸ™‚
